titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Joseph J. Casale, Jr. Diary 1997-1997
titlestmt.subtitle: Casale, Joseph J. , Jr. Diary Mss. Acc. 2009.157

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Ute Schechter, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Joseph J. Casale, Jr. Diary, 1997-1997 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.157
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Diary, 1997 of Joseph J. Casale, Jr. (1957-2008) who was HIV / AIDS infected at the time he wrote his entries. Casale, who describes himself as someone who likes "men mostly, but ...also love(s) women" mainly writes about the reaction of family and friends to his disease, and his struggle to come to terms with his terminal illness. In the back of the diary he sketched out his will. The entries cover about 15 pp.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph J. Casale, Jr. Diary, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 04/10/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and described in April 2009 by Ute Schechter.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph J. Casale was 40 years old at the time he wrote his diary in 1997. The Social Security death index shows a Joseph J. Casale (1957-2008) of Daytona Beach, Volusia, Florida. Since the diary was purchased from a dealer in the same city, it is very likely that Joseph J. Casale (1957-2008) of Daytona Beach is the author of the diary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary, 1997 of Joseph J. Casale, Jr. (1957-2008) who was HIV / AIDS infected at the time he wrote his entries. Casale, who describes himself as someone who likes "men mostly, but ...also love(s) women" mainly writes about the reaction of family and friends to his disease, and his struggle to come to terms with his terminal illness. In the back of the diary he sketched out his will. The entries cover about 15 pp.
